title: Bi-Weekly Career and Hiring Discussion Thread
selftext:
Hello r/india! If you need any suggestions/help regarding your career, ask here. If your company is hiring or if you are looking for a job, then post here.

**If You or Your Company is Hiring:**

1. Name of the company
2. Location
3. Requirements
4. Preferred way of contacting you

**If You are looking to get hired**

1. Your skillset/experience
2. Portfolio (if any/applicable)
3. Location
4. Preferred way of contacting you

Please do not mention your emails. You can/should prefer to take conversation forward in PMs instead to avoid any privacy mishaps.

Do follow up here with your experience. Did you get a job or hire someone successfully via these threads? Your feedback helps!

**Career Thread is posted every two weeks on Thursday mornings |** [**Old Threads**](https://reddit.com/r/india/search?q=Career+and+Hiring+thread&restrict_sr=on&sort=new&t=all)

comments: Any digital artists looking for a side gig? I need a digital cover designed quickly

I got a placement right out of college as a software developer in a nice bank. So, this is my first job. I want to leave my job because I do not like the tech stack. We work with Angular and C sharp. I am a fresher and learnt both recently. Everyone in my team is a senior developer and have 10+ years of experience. I don’t feel comfortable working with them. I don’t feel like I am learning at the pace that they’d expect me to. I don’t relate to them they’re all old and wise. I feel stupid talking to them. And now after 10 months I feel like I don’t like coding altogether. I am stressed all the time and I want to die every morning before logging in. None of these feels like a reason enough to leave this job since its my first job at a good company and it pays well. But I want to leave. And I want to switch fields to something business related. The only way I see how to do that is to get into a good B school and get an MBA. Now, the problem is:

Before my full time employment there was an internship period of 6 months which started in January 2022. So now, I’ve been working here for 10 months, out of which only 4 months are considered as full time. 
So if I give my 3 months notice right now and leave after 3 months, then I will technically only have 7 months of full time experience even though having worked for 13 months. Now I know that leaving a company before a year has a huge impact on your CV. Especially when I want to do an MBA. But i really want to leave this job and I want to leave it right now. Can I? Should I?

Looking to get hired for roles in IT Project Lead , Project Manager. 

Drop in the details. 
Thanks
Hey I am not looking for work but can you explain what digital cover is

Not a career expert but life's too short to feel like dying everyday. 

Bail if you can dude. Just have enough savings and skills to save yourself from starvation. Good day.
Im looking for work! Dm me the deets plz.
Hiring or looking to get hired ?
2nd one, edited
Can you share cv to anuj@goaffpro.com ?
Can you share your cv over DM?
Can you share your CV please?
Don't quit. Take up another job if you dislike this one. Leaving a company regardless of duration will do worse for your career

Looking to get hired (My survival depends on it):

Semi-Qualified Cost and Management Accountant with 2 years of professional working experience in Accounts Payable process, as a Finance Trainee, in Indian Oil Corporation Limited and Bharat Heavy Electricals Limited.

Hands on experience with SAP FICO module, WrenchENT Client (a DBMS tool), Ramco systems modules (ERP Software), and MS Office (Excel and Word).

Location: Delhi NCR (WFH/WFO/Full Time/Part Time)

Please DM me If you have any work opportunities related to my work experience and skills. And if it's something which is not from my background, we can discuss it together to see wheather I'm the right fit for it. 

Thank you.

Looking for career advice:

I have passed my MBBS in 2020 but have left the internship midway due to utter lack of interest and health issues.
I'm currently left with provisional certificate.
I have decent computer knowledge and writing skills and a good command over English.

I want to know what are the career options I have and I'm willing to put effort into getting a high paying job and learn necessary skills.

Plz help me.
Digital cover - 'cover' image for an eBook
Sent you a DM
Got it

I run a design agency in Bangalore and have worked with 12 companies in the last 15 months of starting up. Currently, have 4 clients and am looking to expand.

Anyone who needs help with UX design here?
danks, ill look into it
private man  sent message to you
